README¶

The openemory software is a repository-backed open-access institutional repository front-end designed and maintained for Emory University faculty by the University Libraries staff. openemory is written in Python, uses the Django web framework, and uses Fedora Commons for the repository back-end.

The public website for OpenEmory is available at https://open.library.emory.edu/.

Contact Information¶

The openemory software was developed by the Digital Programs and Systems Software Team, with project management and leadership from the Scholarly Communications Office, at Emory University Libraries.

libsysdev-l@listserv.cc.emory.edu

License¶

The openemory software is distributed under the Apache 2.0 License.

Installation and upgrade instructions are available in DEPLOYNOTES. Features and changes by version are listed in CHANGELOG. Developers should consult DEVELOPER NOTES for development-specific instructions and configurations.
